messages.message: How do we handle diacritic characters? - does that depend on what ocr we use?
We need to enable the right language with the 'HQ Docs' as the OCR model..
if the customer doesn’t want them… can we remove them so that é will be e ?
unfortunately not at the moment!! I don't know the full set of diacritic chars, if it's a limited set we can simply search and replace these chars with their equivalent :slightly_smiling_face:
AH ok. NatWest downstream system cannot accept them… so we will have to write an apply udf to remove them? CC @jayasooryan

@Aimé if we are using Marx 2.0 (we are for CDD)… it will always look for English words written in basic Latin characters. I would not expect Marx to ever return diacritic characters. Only Abby will do this, and only if we tell it to look for words written in a language that uses diacritic chars
Ok. So just to confirm. If it read Aimé it would extract Aime ?
Yes, that is the default behaviour of Marx 2.0 (which we are using)
And anyway on passports we extract name primarily from the MRZ which already has Aimé written as AIME
